title.value: Pruning Sparse Tensor Neural Networks Enables Deep Learning for 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy
title.justification: This is the formal title of the research paper.
title.quote: Pruning Sparse Tensor Neural Networks Enables Deep Learning for 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy

extractions.description: This paper explores the use of Sparse Tensor Neural Networks to reduce memory usage and improve the performance of deep learning models for 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM). Several approaches to efficiently convert ultrasound data into a sparse format are examined, along with the impacts on performance and memory requirements. The study shows that sparse formulations can significantly reduce memory costs and enable effective scaling of ULM from 2D to 3D, even with high concentrations of microbubbles.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to study the memory usage and performance improvement of using Sparse Tensor Neural Networks in 3D ULM.
type.quote: Our contributions can be summarized as follows: • A sparse formulation of Deep-stULM outperforming conventional ULM in 2D. • A comparative study in silico between ULM and the proposed approach under varying concentrations in 3D. • A 2-D in silico study of performance and memory usage of dense-to-sparse conversion strategies.

primary_research_field.justification: The primary focus is on applying deep learning techniques to improve 3D Ultrasound Localization Microscopy.
primary_research_field.quote: Index Terms—Deep Learning, 3D imaging, Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM), Sparse Tensor Neural Networks

sub_research_fields.justification: The application domain of the deep learning methods discussed is in medical imaging, specifically ultrasound localization microscopy.
sub_research_fields.quote: Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM) is an imaging method that non-invasively maps the vascular tree and blood velocities at depth in vivo.

name.justification: Deep-stULM is a significant deep learning model discussed in the paper for Ultrasound Localization Microscopy.
name.quote: We converted the dense Deep-stULM architecture to a sparse formulation without additional change, this approach is designated as Sparse Deep-stULM hereafter.

caracteristics.justification: Deep-stULM uses convolutional architectures for the localization of microbubble positions.
caracteristics.quote: Several deep learning approaches [19, 20] use convolutional architectures where the microbubble position is projected onto a grid with a finer resolution than the input signal.

name.justification: This sparse version of the Deep-stULM model is central to the paper's contributions.
name.quote: We converted the dense Deep-stULM architecture to a sparse formulation without additional change, this approach is designated as Sparse Deep-stULM hereafter.

caracteristics.justification: Sparse Deep-stULM is also based on convolutional architectures but uses sparse tensors to reduce memory costs.
caracteristics.quote: For each intermediate layer, Sparse Tensor Neural Networks only apply their convolution and activation on non-zero values, yielding another sparse tensor.

name.justification: This is another deep learning model used as a baseline for performance comparisons.
name.quote: We also provide the results of a standard, non-deep-learning ULM method, described in [3].

caracteristics.justification: Conventional ULM uses a standard algorithm with Gaussian fitting and tracking for microbubble localization.
caracteristics.quote: We also provide the results of a standard, non-deep-learning ULM method, described in [3].

name.justification: This 2D dataset was specifically used for training and evaluating the Sparse Tensor Neural Networks.
name.quote: 1) 2D dataset: To compare Sparse Tensor Neural Networks with their dense counterpart, we based our study on a previously introduced dense method [22] and used the same 2D dataset based on the previously published simulation pipeline.

name.justification: This 3D dataset was used to extend the study from 2D to 3D ULM and evaluate performance and memory requirements.
name.quote: 2) 3D Dataset: The 3D dataset was obtained similarly but since they contain more parameters, additional microbubble trajectories were included to reduce overfitting.

name.justification: PyTorch is a popular deep learning library that was used for the implementation of models in the study.
name.quote: 2) Training procedure: For the 2D models based on Deep-stULM, the hyperparameters were set to the same value as in the original study [22]: the optimizer used was Adam [29] and the training was divided into two parts.

name.justification: CometML was used to monitor the memory usage during training.
name.quote: c) Memory monitoring: We monitored the memory usage of the training using CometML and took the maximum value reached during the training of each method.
